snippet: The report challenges assertions by the Japanese government that whaling is a tradition with wide support among Japanese consumers.
abstract: Report compiled by International Fund for Animal Welfare challenges Japanese government's assertions that whaling is tradition with wide support among Japanese consumers; says that Japan has been propping up its whaling industry with nearly $400 million in tax money, stepping up subsidies even as consumption of whale meat has dwindled.
lead_paragraph: The report challenges assertions by the Japanese government that whaling is a tradition with wide support among Japanese consumers.

headline.seo: Japan Spends Heavily to Keep Whaling Industry Afloat, Report Says
headline.main: Japan Subsidy for Whaling Is Challenged
headline.print_headline: Japan Subsidy For Whaling Is Challenged
